title: WCAS AFST 390-0-20 Topics in African Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
AFST 390-0-20 "Contemporary African Politics" Martha Wilfahrt, Spring 2017 (also POLI_SCI 360)

Students will develop a rich understanding of African politics from the pre-colonial period to the present, and will be able to analyze and discuss contemporary African politics in light of historical forces. Specifically, students will be able to analyze and discuss: local experiences of democracy and governance; the challenges of economic development; and national as well as international policy responses. The topics will be considered in light of: varied colonial experiences; nationalist and independence movements; international political economy; and informal sources of political power.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: At the end of the quarter, students should have a strong empirical grasp on the continent's diversity of political experiences and be able to articulate prominent theoretical explanations to explain these trajectories. Students should leave the course able to apply a series of theories and frameworks to explain contemporary political issues in African politics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: In-class quizzes, midterm, take-home final, in-class presentation

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Course Reader
